intro: Euonymus europaeus f. atrorubens, commonly known as the red-leaf euonymus, is a decorative shrub characterized by its striking foliage. It features oval to elliptical leaves that turn a vibrant red in the autumn, adding ornamental value to gardens. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in the spring, followed by orange-red蒴果 that persist through the winter. It is native to Europe and thrives in full sun to partial shade conditions. This cultivar is valued for its seasonal color changes and adaptability to various soil types.
